data.title: Best pizza ever!!!
data.text: I have eaten at Mary's since I was a kid back in the late 60's. My dad was friends with Mary and her husband. Mary use to make us the bambino pizza and send us outside to eat. I will always eat Mary's over anyone else's pizza. They will make it to your specifications. Family friendly and you don't need a reservation. They also have a terrific dog-in-a-blanket and awesome salads.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Went to dinner and service was a bit slow. And they were not even very busy. Had a great bowl of pasta nice and hot and tasty. Lots of bread to soak up sauce. Oh pasta was chicken fettuccine. OK place for a early dinner

data.title: There are some pluses
data.text: The Mary's salad is really great.  It has shredded carrots, three bean salad, boiled egg, mushrooms, cheese and salami.  The dressings are all house made and quite noteworthy.  The pizza is average and I just flat-out don't like the meatballs (they are nasty in my opinion, though others seem to like them).  There are several of them and they are all great for kids.  Your best bet here is to stick to salad and pizza.  There is a full bar and the wine list is really not up to par, especially for the wine country!

data.title: Pizza OK
data.text: Thought the pizza was just okay.  We ordered the thin crust pizza and thought it was quite bready to be called "thin" crust.  Not one of our favorite finds in Santa Rosa.

data.title: Stop in for a bite and or a drink
data.text: I have been to all the Mary's Pizza shacks in Sonoma County... This one is truly has a different appeal... Its in Downtown SR where all walks of life hangout and or visit... This spot is very spacious and the food is good. I stopped in with some friends for a quick bite to eat and some drinks.... Before we knew it, we were all having a great time catching up as we have been friends for over 20 years... Friendly environment type watering hole..

data.title: Great local pizza,pasta
data.text: A great local pizza place that has great pasta dishes as well. Wonderful lasagna and delicious bread. Helpful and friendly staff buzz around a warm inviting restaurant.

data.title: Always good
data.text: I love Mary's I have never had a bad meal. The eggplant, the pasta, sandwichs, salads are great. Best Buy for good food and great service.

data.title: Casual good food
data.text: We really liked the minestrone soup. Beef in the minestrone would have made it easy to just have that for lunch. But we went for the BLT sandwich as well. The bacon was cooked perfectly and that tomatoes were ripe. Big menu so there's something for everyone

data.title: Just above average
data.text:
Once in awhile, rather than just bringing home a Costco pizza or baking up a frozen Dijourno, you might feel inclined to take the family out to pizza instead, but definitely don't want to go some place too fancy that your smartphone addicted kids won't appreciate anyway...that's where Mary comes in.  Not cheapass, but not fancy either. Good for a high school or college first date, but probably not if you're in your 30s and up.  

$10.50 for a large Mary's Signature Salad...pretty good, nothing crazy. Easily shared between three people.  
$10.50 for a half liter of Sangiovese(red wine)...very nice! 
$25.95 for a large Mary's Combination Pizza...this is definitely better than Costco's $10 supreme pizza, but I don't think its 2.6 times better to justify the high price. Maybe $20?

Above average

data.title: Satisfying family restaurant in DT Santa Rosa
data.text: Warm atmosphere with standard Italian menu, with a couple of awesome vegetarian options (try the artichoke eggplant sandwich.. sooo good!!).  Proves its value in the portions.  Great customer service.

data.title: Reasonably priced, not too crowded, and good!
data.text: This is a family style pizza joint.  There were plenty of kids running around, but it was not unruly or distracting.  This is just your typical "want some good pizza without going broke" pizza place.  We were there on a Friday night and did not have any trouble getting seated or served.  We really enjoyed it.  We would eat here again.

data.title: Not just pizza -- vibrant Italian restaurant
data.text: I've been to several of the Mary's restaurants -- while the menu is the same, the atmosphere can be quite different.  This review is for the downtown location.  It's more vibrant (and louder) than most of the others.  The service was friendly, although a bit slow at the end (took a while to get our check).  The food is good -- our friends loved their pizza, while my chicken parm was a bit overcooked.  The value is O.K.

data.title: reasonably priced pastas pizzas salads
data.text: We hired Mary's to cater a birthday party for 70 people (I live out of town).  The ease of reviewing the catering menu (and prices) on-line was extremely helpful.  Spoke with manager re recommendations.  Ordered tray of Pesto Rigatoni with meat sauce (serves 30) and tray of Pesto Penne (serves 30) was delicious.  AWESOME salad tray (ordered 3).  including two of each dressings (chunky bleu, ranch and Italian).  Manager recommended pizza appetizers, cut into approx 45 slices - we ordered 3.  Everything was delicious.  Order included serving utensils, plenty of napkins, forks, knives and spoons.  I called the day of and paid over the phone.  Easy!  Delivery was prompt.  I would definitely call on Mary's again. I'm a very happy customer.

data.title: Sloppy
data.text: When our soups came out it looked like someone missed the bowl and the only soup my father and I got was on the rim of the dish, not to mention it tasted like canned soup. The waiter seemed like he was in a hurry to serve just to get to other tables, but all he did was talk to his buddies behind the bar. There was no refill on drinks even on our waters. Looking around the room there seemed to be at least 20 staff members working and this service was a joke. When our entrées arrived, 50 minutes after being seated, the plating looked similar to the soups. I ordered the meat tortellini and after eating a few there was no meat. So I dissected a tortellini to find no meat, but only cheese. Disappointed I played around with the creamy pesto sauce left on my plate to discover one chunk of chicken. All in all it wasn't the best experience.

data.title: You can't go wrong here
data.text: We arrived in Santa Rosa in the pouring rain and desperately looked for a place to have lunch.  We stumbled across "Mary's" and it was practically empty, so we were seated right away.  The food was delicious and the service was fabulous!  I had the Bambino pizza with pesto chicken and mushrooms, and it was plenty big enough.  A big shout out to JORDAN, our waitress, who took care of all our needs competently, kindly, and with the perfect balance of humour and professionalism - a rare find these days.  Give her a raise!  :)

data.title: Skip Mary's and Go Somewhere Else.
data.text: I hate to write this review because I was basically raised on Mary's Pizza. My grandparents used to take me and my siblings to Mary's for Bread Sticks and blue cheese dressing. This place has gotten super expensive over the years and sadly the food has gone down in quality. The bread sticks are smaller and less tasty. There are so many better places to get pizza in Sonoma county. Want flat pizza with very little taste go to little ceasers and save your money.

data.title: Great Local Chain
data.text: Mary's is consistently good at any location. They've been part of Sonoma County for morethan 40 years that I recall, starting out as a "shack" (really!) on Hwy 12 in Boyes Hot Springs. Pizza is great, of course - I love a one-slice pepperoni lunch with a "Mary's" salad (traditional italian presentation). Their bleu cheese dressing is my favorite.

data.title: Good food, friendly service
data.text: While looking for a late dinner in the downtown area we happened upon Mary's Pizza Shack. We were not disappointed. They had a nice variety on the menu, and the pizza was very good. I would definitely go back.

data.title: It is not Italian food but not bad
data.text:
I think they have to improve their choice of Italian food and make better pizzas. Pasta is good and also salad. 
the place is big but sometimes there's line and you have to wait a lot for have a table and wait also for being served.

data.title: Good all-around pizza
data.text: Good overall pizza. Good sauce, nice crust and ample toppings. Friendly service and reasonable. Have occasionally had other food, and it was adequate. I come here mostly for pizza when I'm in this neighborhood.
